intro: Meibomia rottleri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom at night. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit, it is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
